channel.title: How to portfoward?
channel.description: Ok, I need help portfowarding my server because using hamachi is not doing anything for me, just gaining me 1 players per 3 weeks. So, I already portfowarded I guess? But its not working, I did what all the guides say, dl JDK, set up the environmental varibles, used no-ip and set up a host, dled the DUC for it, went to my ip address in the browser (192.168.2.* Not with the star) And added the thing with the name, TCP, port, and applyed the changes, it like magic its supposed to work? 1 thing is having to do the internet protocol 4 thing, I think that messed up my internet because I could not connect until I reset my router and modem 8 hours later. Is there any safe way to fix this without screwing up my internet?

item.title: How to portfoward?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

if you CANNOT portforward with an router, then use utorrent
IF YOU CANNOT portforward with that, your last option would be getting a vps
There is no way it can fail because all ports on a vps are already forwarded

Read full topic

item.title: How to portfoward?
item.dc:creator: @Love_me_plox Love me plox
item.description:
@Love_me_plox wrote:

There are tons of guides on this just look around.

item.title: How to portfoward?
item.dc:creator: @Cyborg101 Cyborg101
item.description:
@Cyborg101 wrote:

Ok, I need help portfowarding my server because using hamachi is not doing anything for me, just gaining me 1 players per 3 weeks. So, I already portfowarded I guess? But its not working, I did what all the guides say, dl JDK, set up the environmental varibles, used no-ip and set up a host, dled the DUC for it, went to my ip address in the browser (192.168.2.* Not with the star) And added the thing with the name, TCP, port, and applyed the changes, it like magic its supposed to work? 1 thing is having to do the internet protocol 4 thing, I think that messed up my internet because I could not connect until I reset my router and modem 8 hours later. Is there any safe way to fix this without screwing up my internet?

Read full topic
